review: I used Dr. Moku (online site) to learn Hiragana, but from the amount I played of this it seems like a solid way to learn. It would have been a lot better if it had Katakana, and if it had Kanij it would have been perfect. If this ever gets Kanji DLC I would happy throw $40 at this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014749813', 'num_games_owned': 1174, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1467160566}
review:
If your want to learn Hiragana, rather download any app for your smartphone. Search for one with user tips. Those are far better than the "tips" given in the game which basically just tell you the number of strokes to write the character with and to watch out for the placement.
The apps will also include more than just Hiragana.
The game itself is very clunky with its controls and rather dull to play.
As a free hobby game i wouldn't mind, but it's not worth it even with the summer sale discount given the free alternatives at hand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028463816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1467105693}

author: {'steamid': '76561198193116154', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1467076165}
review:
Japanese to Survive delivers an exceptional introduction to those learning the language for the first time. The game provides a overview of Hiragana syllables, the fundamental writing system of Japanese grammar, with a number of vocabulary terms. Intermediate learners can brush up on old lessons while wishfully hoping on Katakana and Kanji DLC inclusions.

In the story, you play as a group of teenagers battling to retake their village from omnious "Hiragana warriors." The premise of a village being overthrown by Japanese syllables graciously teeters the line between cheesy educational writing and the script to a B+ anime. Writing aside, Japanese to Survive pairs its lessons with turn-based RPG battle sequences that ensure you are always reviewing material.

Overall, I highly suggest Japanese to Survive to any first-timers or anyone initially intimidated by a highly symbolic, Asian language. Each lesson is succinct in educating the player about the pronunciations, translations and writing strokes of each Hiragana character. The battles are a rewarding experience, knowing that you are applying the knowledge you just learned. I recommend having a pen and notebook ready alongside each playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960554274', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1466923690}

So far, in around 40 minutes or so I managed to learn 15 hiragana.  I would say that 100% more japanese than I knew prior to buying this game.  The presentation is well done, and you feel like you accomplished something when you can recognize letters without looking back at your notes. 

I think this will be very fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198056661728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1467072794}
review: I only have 4 hours down and I'm learning tons (whilst enjoying the music, artwork and gameplay incredibly)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041995956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1466990656}
review:
I studied Japanese for 2 years in school and 4 years on my own, so I feel this game is a bit below my level, but I wanted a way to refresh on the basics and this game is okay, but also a bit flawed.

There is a lot of grinding in the game, it feels very RPG maker generic in terms of story and graphics, and the game tended to crash on me every hour or so, requiring constant saving or lost effort.

The battle mechanics are okay and help you memorize Japanese characters through rote practice in the RPG battle system, however it's noticably clunky, such as when you try to go down to get back tot he top of your menu, it is disabled and if you overattack an enemy, your next attacker will miss if he still attacked the same target.  Old school stuff that's frustrating.  Still, for an entry level Japanese game it gives you the entire alphabet, plenty of room to practice, and a few phrases and words to go with it.  The best part of the game is easily the last run, where you start using phrases instead of simple sounds to fight enemies.

I would recommend this game to fans of RPGs looking for entry level Japanese knowledge.  Could also be a good gateway for kids.  However, it is noticably clunky and crash prone.  Still, they advertised a sequel and I'd buy it, if only for the practice.  Give it a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166066690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1469289641}
review:
Great Game
If you want to learn Hiragana then you should buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025630961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1467600695}
review:
As someone who learned a bit of conversational japanese, but no hiragana, I think this is a great way to approach the language from a different direction.  A brand new student of the language would probably want to start with a conversational approach, and use this game to supplement.  But that's only to maintain interest.  There's technically no reason a person couldn't start with this game.  

The game is repetitive and grows in complexity pretty quickly.  It's not something you'll want to play for hours on end, but it's not intended for that either.  It's better as a quick daily event over a long period of time.  Really enjoying it so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030846606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1467069218}
review: Definitely a new take on learning Japanese that kept me engaged and wanting more. They dialogue might be a bit cheesey for some people but it doesnt detract from the fantastic game here and its ability to teach you basic Japanese. Highly recommend to anyone interested in learning the language or even if you are like me and just want a fun way to brush up and reinforce the basics!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141281551', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1467056178}
review:
I never thought I'd learn this much through playing a game!
Sometimes it gets a little grindy (you have to kill the same characters over and over) but that helps memorizing those characters (so 'yay' i guess...). 
Only thing I'd point out is that the characters you learn at the begining stop appearing throghout the game, so by the end I didn't remember some of them.
No achievements :(, but if you finish all side quests you get a bonus :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084390721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1467579257}
review:
This is sincerely a brilliant way to teach a language! The story is fun and engaging but doesn't take itself too seriously, the lessons are concise and easy to follow and there's a nice connection, as a player, to your team because you're learning along with them. 

I also love how, as you learn new hiragana, you can go back and review earlier lessons, especially the vocabulary lessons, and rewrite the words using more hiragana each time. I truly and sincerely hope the creators of this game create a follow-up for more advanced learners for the kanji and katakana. 

Would I recommend this game to people wanting to learn Japanese from the very basics? I already have several times and I'm only just barely scratching the surface myself!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076323403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1467002031}
review:
I played this game for a little while so here are my thoughts:

It's interesting in how the story set up to require the characters to learn Japanese. It's cute and defiently something I think would be a good learning aid. Would love to see more games like this out there! 

I would reccomend this game to beginners. People who don't know their hiragana or struggle with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168250502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1466902234}
review: I bought this game because I'm japanese and I know the amount of japanese that a baby knows. I got this game and it was easy to begin with at the start. The controls are simple, the gameplay is interactive, and the teaching is unique and helpful. I've learned more japanese in this game in an hour than I have living my 15 years of life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220156817', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1467041761}
review:
I'm sorry,but i think it is not a good idea to learn Japanese just by this.

Yes, it does provide some necessary things to learn Hiragana, such as how to write, how to read etc.But I think its way to review or remember, is a bit stupid, and quite slow. Killing monsters to make a choice seems interesting, but in fact it can only help you with "recognition", yet you won't learn further usage or practice its pronunciation. Not to mention the less of Katakana -- same or even more common, and should be learned together with Hiragana.I also believe that in this way the learners may not form constant memories and can forget it easily.

Frankly speaking, I felt really excited when I saw this during the period of learning Japanese as a very beginner, and using RPG Maker to make a learning "game" is quite creative.However,compared with my free online video lessons from Netease in China, this is not so cool as I expected.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000545500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1467117625}
review:
I've just completed a beginner course in Japanese so I know hiragana and katakana, but there are just some that you don't see as often so they're easier to forget. Playing this game is really good for that, but it also teaches you words, greetings, etc. I haven't played this game for too long, but I'd like to suggest that the menu should be made easier to navigate (double clicking in some places, single clicking in other places, lots of clicking) - that the option of typing the hiragana instead of scrolling through a long list to be added and it'd be cool if you could customise the main character. I'd love to see a little me sprite going through on an adventure. Plus kanji edition.
Great game, highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000549152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1558798889}
review:
Classic turn based RPG style.
You don't have to worry about any other abilities apart from answering the hiragana characters properly and healing.
I don't think I've ever taken notes before in a video game.
Sank about 6 hours into it on the first day.
I look forward to the next installment on Katakana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051496037', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1467168054}
review: I dont need subtitles anymore when japanese people talk

author: {'steamid': '76561198154396341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1467004008}
review: Works great for a teaching tool, helped me get a structure to learn hiragana and quickly learn it. Dialouge needs some work and I know it's so i get more practice but going back and forth between randomly spawning enemies for some plot reason is the worst. Pretty good other than that and it's dirt cheap, worth the price

author: {'steamid': '76561197972631265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1466984710}
review:
This game is actually useful, very useful. So useful that I have to write a review to testify for it.

I play 1 level a day, 3 days in i've already learned 25 hiragana letters and some vocabs/short phrases.
This is the least boring way i think, and somewhat fun, for people to learn Japanese.

Keep in mind this is more of an educational piece of work than an actual game :0) Or, the only game in this era that can be justified with repetitive grinding, excessive backtracking and overly simplistic dungeon design.

Don't try to punch through it, that's not the point of playing this 'game'. Part of the reasons why I play only 1 level per day is to keep myself interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046523811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1313, 'last_played': 1466973335}
review: While the story and gameplay is nothing revolutionary, this is a welcome change from sitting in a room with flashcards for hours at a tme. The entire campaign took me about 12 hours to complete (the rest of that time is from accidentally leaving the game open overnight), and it is spaced out enough to play the game full through if you'd prefer. I look forawrd to the Katakana sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112773614', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1479061070}
review: Awesome! Now I can read more Japanese than just 'there is a 'no' here and there' :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198138720239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1466966836}
review:
It's fun learning Hiragana with this classic little RPG. Grab a pen and paper to make notes as you battle your way to Hiragana literacy. 

PROS:
- Helpful when traditional learning methods aren't your thing
- Teaches words and phrases to support reading words in Hiragana
- Audio pronunciation helps tune your ears and your tongue
- Comments on some common font differences in appearance

CONS:
- Sans serif font on lessons would be appreciated
- Attack menu is rather long. Submenu by consonant/vowel would reduce scrolling.

SCORE: 4/5
Solid little game, DLC for Katakana and/or Kanji would be awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059491817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1468850567}
review:
Un excellent jeu pour connaitre et introduire la langue japonaise, sa culture, ses usages et son vocabulaire pour ceux qui veulent l'apprendre. Mais encore, pour ceux √©galement qui en connaissent les rudiments/bases mais que les ann√©es passant ont √©mouss√© les connaissances en hiragana.
Le faire de mani√®re simple et ludique, en connaissant non seulement la prononciation, mais aussi la mani√®re d'√©crire. Un petit test avant d'entrer en jeu pour p√©r√©niser ses connaissances et sa m√©moire (et occire) des hiraganas est un coup de maitre.

Un jeu parfait pour accompagner ceux qui veulent apprendre le japonais en autodidacte. N'oubliez pas de prendre un carnet pour tout noter et pratiquez (jouez) r√©guli√®rement. N'h√©sitez pas √† faire les qu√™tes secondaires pour en apprendre davantage en mati√®re de vocabulaire et de culture.

A quand le Katakana Battle ou le Kanji Battle ? 
A quand un nouveau jeu pour apprendre une autre langue ? 

L'initiative et l'id√©e du jeu est excellente et je le recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253401911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1468607709}

author: {'steamid': '76561198207146213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1467267555}
review: Absolutely useful for learning Japanese! You can easily get those hiragana characters memorized by fighting against the warriors. The only problem is, it cannot be saved on the steam cloud, I have two computers, and they couldn't share the progress. After all, if you had no idea with Japanese, you can't miss it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106165289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1603972205}
review: DON'T WASTE YOUR F MONEY TO BUY JAPS DICTIONARY. 20/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198109671117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1515100253}
review:
This is the perfect way for someone like me to stay focused and study. I didn't want to stop at all! Can't wait for Katakana Battle to come out, since that's my weakness.  Also hoping for a Kanji version, although it wasn't mentioned in the game. 
Anyway, it's perfect for beginners/intermediates to learn/refresh their memory in Japanese and get some easy vocab in, it just tricks you into keeping it up by mixing in some RPG fun and distracting you by thinking about gearing up/levelling. There's also a few quests, wouldn't mind to see more of those! Definitely worth the money and my time. Keep it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109668872', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1687595826}
review:
A fun way to learn Hiragana. Definitely recommanded.
Less pain, more fun.
Plus its on sale now, grab it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069559674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1466942501}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018997870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1524181753}
review:
J'adore ce petit jeu, c'est vraiment bien fait et tr√®s amusant, le tout en apprenant un peu de ces caract√®res √©tranges japonais. Moi qui adore la culture japonaise, je suis plus qu'enchant√©e par ce jeu. Bravo, j'attend une suite / DLC avec impatience :)

I really like this game, it's really well done and so fun, all that while learning a little bit of those stranges little japanese symbols. I really like japanese culture myself, so this game is really a great thing :). Good job, I'll wait for a sequel / DLC :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198097703740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1484451706}

review:
I'm absolutely loving this game!
First off, its a solid game. Classic RPG with good music and fun gameplay.
Second, I'm totally learning Japanese. Its a very fun and subtle way of commiting hiragana to memory.

10/10, everyone whos interested in learning Japanese should get this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008944406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1466876898}
review: Well put together and constructed, fun to play and easy to follow. Definitely a useful tool to have to help embed the japanese language in your brain in a fun way!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973554575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1634846572}
review: Very easy to get into, and very basic.  This will teach you the Hiragana alphabet and some very, very basic Japanese quite quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057185058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1466848069}
review: This is an extremely addicting educational game. I've tried self teaching learning Japanese using a few books, but that was nearly impossible. This game makes learning a new language somewhat easy and very fun. The combat reinforces the lessons to help you remember the characters. You'll need a notebook and something to write with since you're learning a new language (obviously). So far I've only gotten a bit over 2 hours in the game and I've learned a decent amount about Hiragana. This game looked promising when I purchased it, and it lived up to my expectations. I thought the combat and RPG mechanics would be terrible since it's an educational game; but the game is very solid. The lessons are at a reasonable size so you aren't overwhelmed and it gives you a few hints about the specific character you're learning. Don't forget to take as many notes as possible, it really helps. So far this game has been worth the purchase, a lot of love and work went into this game. If you're looking to learn Japanese you'll want to start with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026359247', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1466883796}
review:
While I haven't played much quite yet, I must say its a really great "game" for introduction to Japanese. 
I've been putting off learning Japanese for far too long and this is just the sort of thing I need to give me the proper steps to learning. 
With it currently being on sale for less than 3 dollars, I'd say thats well worth the price! 
Saves me from trying to teach myself and finding the study materials or paying for a class that would be far more expensive and less fun. 

Will update once I've played more but so far I have no complaints. 
Progress (1 Hour and I know 15 Characters of Hiragana)

author: {'steamid': '76561198108030754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1528597726}
review:
Very neat! I studied Japanese in college and the writing of the characters is very accurate! :) I hope that a katakana and kanji version of this game comes out! It is totally fun and educational.  If you would like to learn the basics of hiragana, I recommend this game! ^.^

Edit: The only character that I have seen which is not accurate is "ri „Çä". They use one stroke writting it in the game, but the written form isn't connected and is done in 2 strokes.  The game does however show the correct form of "ri „Çä" when battling the hiragana warriors.  It is ok for it to be connected on a typed font, but not when hand writting it.  Other than that, kudos for making a game that teaches writting Japanese! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198065272179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1466854447}
review: It's on Steam Sale for a couple bucks, and you should totally pick it up if you have any interest in learning Japanese. The more you farm the more you study. If I could learn more languages in game form, I'd be omnilingual. As expected, the RPG element is a little slower than your average, but it also has to teach you stuff the same time, so give it a sec. It is an awesome experience so far guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001120622', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1501055615}
review: I only did the vowels up to this point but I simply have to say the system to learn the characteers of the japanese language in this game is amazing. In this RPG style you want to optimize your effectivenesss and you do that by remembering (and speaking/writing) those Hiragana. It's ingenious love this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060457030', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1466783015}
review:
The developers did a great job putting together a game that was both fun and educational. I would reccomend this game to anyone looking for a fun way to learn Japanese and also like playing the old pokemon games. This game is very similiar to pokemon, so if you like pokemon you should enjoy this game as well. 

Although for me personally it is quite boring and repetitive, the repetition is what gets all the material into your brain. The diaglogue isn't the best, heck it's even cringy sometimes but whatever. Combat system is meh, exactly like the old pokemon games. All in all, I liked the idea but this game is very settle which might not be suited for everyone.

This game does what it advertises and if you find this game on sale, consider purchasing it. 
8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198020466221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1538949318}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094230527', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1466780050}
review: I am recomending this, but it's really not the best. At best, it's a much cheaper version of Roseta Stone, and the information in the program is helpful, you will learn Hiragana. The problem is, in between lessons, there is a terrible JRPG. Bad dialogue, anoying, shallow, clunky gameplay, and a rediculously slow pace all stand in the way of learning Japanese. Despite all of this, it is still the easiest way to learn Hiragana. I kind of wish they would add mod support so that people could abridge the gameplay, or just make it smoother. I look forward to any sequals that feature Katakana, Kanji, or better gameplay... or better yet, just no gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042304630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1665665888}
review:
I saw this on sale this morning and thought "What the heck?"  Well? Amazing game.  

Forget the added bonus of learning Hiragana. This is an adorable, colorful and delightful old school RPG. The characters are fun, the visual are superb and the music is AMAZING.  

Seriously, if you grew up with 8 Bit RPGs just like I did, you're what... over 40?  You're NOT too old for this educational game.  

I sincerely hope for Katakana and Kanji sequels to this.  Would buy in a heartbeat.

10/10, would learn again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244382448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1517585094}
review:
Petit avertissement avant que je ne commence : la culture Japonaise ne me passionne pas. Alors pourquoi j'ai achet√© ce jeu, me demanderez-vous ? Parce que je suis passionn√© de langues √©trang√®res et que je ne manque jamais une occasion d'en apprendre et de me perfectionner. L√†, en l'occurence, j'ai une occasion d'apprendre le Japonais de mani√®re amusante, c'est-√†-dire √† l'aide d'un RPG, genre avec lequel j'ai grandi. M√™me si, niveau culture, ma passion est plut√¥t situ√©e en Scandinavie. Mais qu'on se le dise avant que j'oublie : jamais un RPG n'a √©t√© aussi instructif.

Alors d√©j√†, ce jeu a bien √©videmment √©t√© fait sous RPG Maker MV. Ne vous arr√™tez pas sur ce d√©tail, il est √©vident d√®s la premi√®re heure de jeu qu'un √©norme travail a √©t√© fourni dedans ! Le sc√©nario de ce jeu tient sur quatre lignes. L√† encore, ne vous arr√™tez pas sur ce d√©tail ! Etant donn√© que l'objectif de ce jeu est d'apprendre une langue et pas de suivre une histoire, c'est tr√®s bien comme √ßa. Attention, il y a bel et bien un sc√©nario, et il est suffisamment ficel√© pour vous pousser √† apprendre le Japonais. Parce que la qualit√© de ce jeu r√©side dans son gameplay. Globalement, comment √ßa fonctionne ?

Dans un √©cran de combat, vous ne combattez pas des monstres. Vous combattez des hiragana. Si vos capacit√©s d√©fensives sont similaires √† un JRPG classique, il n'en est rien pour vos capacit√©s offensives. Vous vous battez avec des romaji (la traduction des syllabes avec les 26 lettres de notre alphabet), et le seul moyen d'infliger des d√©g√¢ts √† un hiragana est de l'attaquer avec le romaji correspondant. Il n'y a aucun autre moyen d'infliger des d√©g√¢ts. En d'autre termes : un combat = un exercice d'entra√Ænement. Jamais le grind n'aura √©t√© aussi instructif.

Tout √ßa c'est bien joli, mais vous allez forc√©ment me faire une r√©flexion : combattre des hiragana en pronon√ßant des romaji fait certes apprendre comment on prononce les hiragana, mais il serait opportun de combattre des lettres de la notation "√† nous" avec des hiragana - c'est-√†-dire faire l'exercice dans l'autre sens. Justement, le jeu a pens√© √† vous et vous le propose √† partir d'un certain stade du sc√©nario. Bon, en fait, vous n'avez pas le choix. Et, cerise sur le g√¢teau : le moment o√π vous devez faire l'exercice dans l'autre sens colle parfaitement au sc√©nario. Je n'en dis pas plus.

Comment fonctionnent les le√ßons ? Concr√®tement, et le jeu met bien l'accent dessus, ce jeu a beau √™tre addictif et amusant, il ne vous instruit seulement si vous jouez le jeu. Pr√©parez un cahier et un stylo ! Les le√ßons sont accompagn√©es d'une musique douce aux sonorit√©s orientales qui est la bienvenue. Le jeu vous apprend non seulement quel romaji va avec quel hiragana, mais √©galement √† les prononcer correctement et √† les √©crire (les hiragana). En effet, la majorit√© des hiragana sont compos√©es de plus d'un coup de crayon, et les coups de crayon ne se font pas dans n'importe quel ordre. Le jeu vous le montre de mani√®re anim√©e.

Vous commencez facilement, en apprenant les voyelles a, i, u, e, o (et pas a, e, i, o, u, mais ne vous en faites pas, vous vous y ferez rapidement). Vous apprendrez ensuite la s√©rie des ka, vous apprendrez au fil du jeu ce qu'est un dakuten et un handakuten et comment ils changent un hiragana. Chaque le√ßon est accompagn√©e d'un quiz pour v√©rifier que vous avez compris la dite le√ßon. Niveau combats, et c'est important de le signaler, lorsque vous arrivez dans une nouvelle zone, vous combattrez, parmi les "monstres", les nouveaux hiragana fra√Æchement appris ET dans la foul√©e, des anciens. Niveau RPG, forc√©ment vos personnages ne gagneront pas grand chose. C'est vous, le joueur, qui r√©viserez vos acquis et consolidez vos connaissances.

Le jeu contient √©galement des qu√™tes annexes qui vous en dira plus sur la culture Japonaise. M√™me si cette culture, comme je l'ai √©voqu√©, ne m'int√©resse pas tellement, un peu d'instruction sur le reste du monde ne fait jamais de mal. Vous apprendrez aussi du vocabulaire. Si vous jouez le jeu jusqu'au bout, vous pourrez √©crire les mots fra√Æchement acquis sur votre cahier. Lorsque vous arriverez √† Tokyo, vous commencerez √† lire vos premiers dialogues en Japonais (m√™me si c'est juste "ohayou gozaimasu", faut bien commencer quelque part). Par exemple, un gar√ßon vous demandera d'acheter un manga dans la boutique. Sauf que dans la boutique, parmi ce que vous pourrez acheter, vous trouverez un tas d'articles dont l'intitul√© est r√©dig√©... En hiragana ! Cela ne se produit pas au d√©but du jeu, aussi ne n√©gligez pas le grind, cela n'a jamais √©t√© aussi instructif.

Concr√®tement, parmi les d√©fauts, il n'y en a qu'un seul : un bug mineur, mais rien de bien m√©chant. Pour ceux qui sont curieux : dans le village en ruines, quand j'ouvre une le√ßon et que je reviens sur la map, l'effet "safran" dispara√Æt. Rien qui n'emp√™che de jouer.

Ce jeu, en plus d'√™tre une tr√®s bonne m√©thode de langue, d√©montre que quoi qu'on en dise, h√© bien oui ! Oui, il est possible de s'instruire gr√¢ce √† un jeu vid√©o ! Et surtout, ce jeu d√©montre que m√™me dans un genre qui ne se pr√™te pas vraiment √† l'√©ducation, il est possible de faire un jeu instructif. Et surtout : un jeu instructif et amusant √† la fois.

A qui s'adresse ce jeu ? Aux "weeabos" qui en ont marre qu'on les appelle "weeabos" et veulent passer aux choses s√©rieuses. A ceux qui veulent apprendre le Japonais, tout simplement. Ou, alors, √† ceux comme moi qui sont passionn√©s de langues √©trang√®res et de RPGs. Surtout qu'√† ce prix-l√†, cela serait vraiment dommage de passer √† c√¥t√©.

Qu'est-ce que vous attendez ?

review: I've played for only about an hour so far and have learned 15 Hiragana letters so far. The story is cute, and the repetitive teaching style is effective for me. Looking forward to "playing" more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044012756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1620249303}
review:
So I'm only, up to the sa, su, shi, so, hiragana and so far it's been a fun experence. I'm starting to remember each character with out my notes (yes they ask you to take notes.) The RPG isn't revationary but, it's gameplay & mechanics are solid. The plot is interesting enough to keep you playing while not distracting you from learning. The lessons are clear and easy to follow.

My only gripe with the game is the brush-style font used, when showing how to write each hiraganana. I'd have prefered the font to look closer to a pen or pencil style to make practicing easier to understand.

On the whole the game is well made and i'd love to see a sequel with katakana (LJTS2! Katakana Battle!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198062145689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1465052254}
review:
I've just finished this 'learning' game (don't know how to call it) recently and would like to give a little review of it. 
This game is the first RPG game that I mostly willing to buy, a game for learning Japanese. When I was searching some random games on Steam and saw this special game. It is hard for me to find a way to start and here it is, a game for the beginner to learn Japanese characters and vocabs. However, I can't fully recommend this game for everyone to play because it is not easy to learn-and-remember in this game, even I take lots of notes and keep practicing on writing the characters. It is a method for me (maybe including anyone) to 'Learn' Hiragana but not 'Remember' Hiragana. Maybe it is just me having some learning problems, but seriously, the game's battle system is quite boring that you focus on defeating the enemies and get money to buy stuffs, then go to the next area and do the same thing. The aim still is still finishing the game and have a happy ending after a while I may forget all I have learnt and wasted several hours. I don't mean that playing this game is wasting time but it is not a choice to keep learning Japanese. Like I said, it is a good start for learning Japanese language but if you have already had a bit or more knowledge of this language, this game may not perform effectively. 
Let me sum up this long freakin' review:
Pro:
- a choice for someone who would like to learn Japanese but don't know where to start
- suitable for someone who like playing RPG games
- educative
- feel fun to learn Japanese name of the daily stuffs
Con:
- quite boring battle system
- not easy to focus on learn-and-remember the Japanese characters
- some of the stuffs in game are useless or unable to use (spoiler alert!) 
All above are just my unprofessional review and give a big support to the developer if you enjoy this game like I do :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004298655', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1464275976}

Get out your Notebook and start LEARNING today!

review: There isn't really much that I can write that no one has before... It's extremely helpful in the learning of Japanese. It breaks down each letter and explains its English counterpart, and shows words with the Romaji (English lettering of Japanese to pronounce it easier) and the Hiragana (regular Japanese letters) to make learning it easier! I do have one issue with this though, it does occasionally run really slow... If yo can fix that that'd be great!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970842259', 'num_games_owned': 1126, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1463972599}
review: This game focuses on a very thin margin of the Japanese writing system. I except that the use of kanji would have likely been outside the scope of this project, but these ‚Äúlessons‚Äù should have also included katakana, which is typically taught in tandem to hiragana, or shortly after. Look elsewhere if your serious about learning, unless your absolutely crazy about the idea of learning these few characters through the interaction of a clunky JRPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026466413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1464313758}
review:
I have been playing it for a few hours now and I can start to feel connections being made and the characters being committed to memory. A very good resource for beginners like me. 

I have two suggestions for the dev:

  1. For the player to be able to go back in text. As in, go to the text passage prior, it's nothing major but it saves the player needing to review an entire lesson to read only one passage. I think this would be a practical addition to a great learning resource and fun game!

  2. For the writing segments to use only one image of the character, or to have both images side by side and to have the drawn image stay on the screen until a button press. Currently the different 'fonts' being used for the writing section add a layer of inconsistency that can make stroke placement uncertain.

All in all, this is a great way to lay the foundations of future language study.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167254553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1467, 'last_played': 1464208368}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056090481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1463891507}
review:
Never left a review, haven't even played for long, but I honestly really love this!

The premise is great: Learn or die.

Now, it's not stressful or anything. In fact, you can take it at a very slow pace if you want. It's just that added incentive of "I don't want to lose, I don't want the monster to defeat me, so I WILL learn this." Normally, tbh, I start to learn something, but I get bored easily. I'm always flitting around from task to task, hobby to hobby, but games are the one thing I can easily focus on for hours on end. Honestly, I want a whole series of these games. I want them for kanji and katakana too. I want them for other languages. I want to battle and play my way into becoming a linguistic GOD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038797115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1463794935}
review: Amazingly enough i learned ALOT of Hiragana from this! Dont go into this expecting a great story but expect a great learning tool.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983622435', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1463276639}
review:
Amazing!
Before I get into detail, I want to view this game from two different angles and review them seperately.

Learning:
This just blew me away! Within 10 hours of gaming split across two days I was able to master all the hiragana and learn some basic vocabulary. I spoke some japanese phrases beforehand but never bothered learning how to write so this was totally new to me.
I found the lessons to be very well paced and never felt over- nor underwhelmed.

Gaming:
Likely made with some version of the RPG Maker, so adjust your expectations accordingly.
I always liked the RPG Maker games so this was totally fine to me. 
The graphics are nicely done and quite fitting. Sound and music are your typical 8-bit retro RPG sounds, so don't expect an amazing OST.
The story, while absolutely sufficient for this kind of game, is the only weak point. A very very basic RPG story that tries to take two interesting turns, but those are easily predictable. For this kind of game I don't see this as a bad thing though because you can easily take a break and absorb what you've learned without wondering all day how the story will continue. If the story was too good you might end up rushing to the finish in one session (which is totally possible) and end up with way too much to learn.

Overall I can only recommend this game to anyone who wants to learn hiragana and I'll definitely buy the Katakana sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101604779', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1167, 'last_played': 1484274424}
review: I think this game did very well in teaching hirigana in a video game format. I learned that hirigana is only a fraction of the Japanese language but it is the beginning and the foundation of llearning this language. It is definately more fun than I classroom and I recommend this if you want to start learning Japanese like I did when i got this game. Am honestly the game is not difficult like some people would say. When you're learning a lesson write everything down and make a cheat sheet to help you memorize the hirigana. THen it's a easy, breezy, kinda silly, adventure to save your land and Japan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080268954', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1490748193}
review: Amazing game! Helped imensley with how I was learning Hiragana in an interesting fashion. Easy to understand lessons and an interesting plot. My only wish is that there was more time to go over vocabulary near the ending, I understood most of it but I couldn't help forgetting a few words like Ticket, aeroplane and bus. :P Freaked the heck out of me since i needed them for the final battle. I'm looking forward to Katakana Wars, your next game and I'll definatley play it. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198154376455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1462420777}
review:
A fun game, regardless of whether you know Hiragana already or not.
You start off with the vowels and learn the other characters 5 at a time.
If you already know Hiragana you can expect about 6 hours of gameplay.
10/10 would play the Katakana version when/if it comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029114626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1462199763}
review:
Sadly I have to concur with the negative reviews.

The interface is clunky and bad. It takes way too long of a time to navigate and it's frustrating. The people who defend it with "It was made in RPG maker" or "It's a JRPG, that's what it's supposed to be like" are missing the point. This game could have been made so much easier and more user friendly.

Why does it HAVE to play like a JRPG? It can mimic the graphical style and look like one but there's no reason for it to play like one. Why couldn't I be able to just select the Japanese character on the screen and then select the correct corresponding romanji in a menu at the bottom, an entire attack made with TWO clicks of the mouse? Does anyone REALLY think it's better to have to go through menus clicking "Attack" and then "Answer" and then the correct answer in a list that covers the entire screen and THEN the character the answer is for. And for EVERY character in the party?

This is far too slow and awkward to be effective learning. It's not that difficult a game to make.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012215925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1462622585}
review:
This game is too hard and it is aggravating, the enemies are way too powerful.

Edit: I went online and did some in-browser flashcard games, after that I could remember the characters better, however it seems to me that if I have to play another flash card game just to get better so I can defeat the ingame enemies then the game has lost all relevance and is not really worth playing, might aswell just stick with the browser based game. In this game you will often encounter the same characters in a group on any level, making the game repetitive.

A fast ingame flashcard system that isn't seperated by dialoge, and more diverse types of enemies may have made this game much better. If you are doing your first semster of learning Japanese then this game might be a helpful addition to your studies, for everyone else, probably not recommended.

review:
I'd like to say, that it's the best application i ever used learning foreign language!
It was really interesting to learn basics of Japanese using this product, because developers made this game with two constituents inside: entertainment + language practice in the same time. You're interested in learning to continue the storyline, so stimulus to learn is guaranteed. What could be better for beginner than that? By the way, during the game process, you learn some grammar rules and interesting facts about Japan, so this game is not limited only with Hiragana characters. 
Conclusion: i recommend this product!

author: {'steamid': '76561198257897274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1460419048}
review: I love learning Hiragana with Hiragana Battle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097362378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1461528207}
review: One of the best games I have ever played. Not because of story or graphics but because of its genious way of teaching you foreign language . Story is very straightforward and simple . 3 friends and their teacher Misaki are battling against enemies ... a Hiragana syllables and words and their evil wizard master Noburo . Combat system is the same as in any other classic JRPG , where you have to choose correct answer ( translation) to each Hiragana symbol so you can defeat them . You can upgrade your weapons and armour , and do side quests . You have to keep in mind that this game is made mainly to teach you whole Hiragana alphabet so you will have to be patiente and take your time and make notes. Once you realize you are able to read some words in ingame stores ( where you are buying gear , healing  etc. ) it will be motivation for you to continue . Good luck and never give up ! Iam looking forward to see another game from the creators of this one . It should be called "Learn Japanese to Survive : Katakana War!" Cant wait to play that !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116603796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1595513637}
review: This a great game to play if you want to learn the hiragana.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982005593', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1665085112}
review:
First the bad news:
If you're looking for a traditional JRPG, there are far better alternatives out there in terms of story, gameplay and animation quality. Both input methods (keyboard and controller) are cumbersome and there's no option to rebind any buttons or keys. The battles are highly repetitive and you'll need some old school notebook (the paper kind) and a pen in order to really get something out of it.

Sounds like a lot of negative points right? So why do i still recommend this?

Because this game delivers what it advertises. It's teaching you a pretty complex language in a fun way, by going step by step and repeating the important parts often enough to keep them in your head. You're not only taught the writing system Hiragana along with the pronunciation of the characters but also basic conversational skills, important words and a bit of japanese culture. And the rudimentary RPG style is an additional motivation to keep going. "Just five more battles until i can afford that new sword" means that you voluntarily repeat a lesson 5 times more. And no matter what "wholesome" or "natural" approaches to language learning might say, practice is what makes you perfect.

Keep in mind though that this will only teach you one of the three writing systems. If you really want to learn japanese, this can only be complimentary to real language lessons (online or in class).

author: {'steamid': '76561198002182722', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1460472100}

review: This is a great game to supplement learning Japanese.  It goes over hiragana as well as a bit of vocabulary.  However, don't expect much more than this.  As far as the game itself, it is short, easy, and the story is forgettable...but it works well enough to keep you battling until the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278739680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1640190786}
review: It was well done, i learned. It recommends to write notes and study, it moves at a well pace if you do. Without it you can quickly get lost in the sheer number of characters (Japenese letters) you have to memorize. I had a lot of fun. It Goes over everything and leaves no small detail untouched. Its our job to learn and memorize, all they have to do is give us the practice sheet. Which they absoulutely do! The graphics and music also made it all the more enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142355612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1533838269}
review:
6 hours in now and i feel that im learning the hiragana charecters really fast, i have taken other langauges before and ive never really caught on that quick. To english people all this at the start feels very alien like. to me in the past it has felt as if it were next to impossible to pick up but after playing this and practicing writting the charecters that it trys to teach you it sticks, and constantly running into the "Hirigana Warriors" as they are called helps an awfull lot because its throwing these charecters youve learned at you all the time and as you progress it still throws some old ones at you again and you think oh yea thats one ive already learnt. So you dont literally forget after 20 mins off not seing it. Other than that i will say its good to take breaks and refresh your mind like the game says to do iff your strugling as it does help.

As for Story its quite fun actually the game will keep you entertained, You start off in this litle peacefull village and end up in a tavern talking with some friends, when your finished you go outside and a mysterious man appears and thats where the journey will begin. You travel around a map to new places and from what i can tell you end up in a distant land called "japan". For me its not like going to school and just having a teacher tell you do this and do that, and the side quests aswell are cool because they tell you a litle bit about culture in japan. They Can also teach you new phrases aswell. 

I feel you will  have to play the game yourself to see what its like to be honest as i know alot off people learn in different ways, for me this is a good way for learning and i am enjoying it at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044031861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1461254762}
review:
First of all I'd like to say that I couldn't recommend this game enough to someone wishing to learn Japanese from the ground up, or anyone wanting to practice their Hiragana (I fall into the prior category.) If you like JRPGs or RPG maker games, this could greatly benefit you as well. Mouse controls are very useful- after figuring them out I found myself using them more or less all the time.

But I'd like to give some spoiler-free constructive criticism for the game.

[list]
    [*]Lack of variation in waves: I'm to understand that when making a game in RPG maker, one would have to create set "troops" of enemies(Making this a difficult point to improve upon), but I find myself sometimes remembering Hiragana characters solely upon their placement within their troops, which isn't a practical way to remember Hiragana.
    [*]Takes itself a bit too seriously as an RPG: Having to keep track of a storyline and stats is commonplace in a typical RPG, but here is just feels strange. Sorry if this is a bit of a nitpick!
    [*]More boss fights would be very welcome: I found the most fun (and rewarding) parts of the game were the boss fights with Noburo, where a stream of characters would spawn (even better with the final boss's final form- I may go back and play just that a few more times), but I felt like these weren't really explored enough. A boss fight per "world" would be a welcome change in my eyes.
    [*]More "other dimension" areas: These were among the most challenging segments of the game in my eyes, and I would have loved to see an area where you have to translate english words to their Japanese equivalent.
[/list]

Great job, I look forward to the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087338186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1461087264}
review:
I first took classes in Japanese over 20 years ago and I struggled with being able to read it.    
I tried rosetta stone.  
Learn Japanese to Survive! Hiragana battle actually worked well.  
By the end of a play through I'm able to recognise by sight some words in hiragana.  
This was a great format to get enough repetition in for the recognizing the characters to stick.  

Plus it was fun.  

A great investment.  I'm looking forward to the next game (regarding katakana).

author: {'steamid': '76561198119577772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1522580452}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112248464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1459694484}
review:
This game did not dissapoint. It takes a fun approach to learning Japanese, and varies up the studying by also teaching some culture and vocabulary. The fighting is very, very basic, but does its job and although I never died in game, that doesnt mean its easy. I especially want to commend the Final dungeon and final boss as they shook up the gameplay and the final boss even managed to be intense. How do you manage to pull that off in an educational game!? 

Yeah, the battles and the questing are kind of shallow and wouldn't hold your interest if this was any other game.
I would have liked them to vary the enemies better, as its way to easy to know what hiragana to use if you only use the latest we learned every quest. It only rarely switches things around, if more quests were like the final dungeon, it would be more engaging, I feel. 

In the end though, I finished the game and I am FULLY confident in my Hiragana skills. 
maybe particles could use some work though idk...
Regardless! I fully recommend this title. Its a good start to learning and they explain very well, I never had any issue with the teaching, and this game is a good example on the viability of Games as Education. Good job, guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983007542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1982, 'last_played': 1510995088}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998162775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1459633350}
review:
the beginning is drawn out forever. then it plays ok, even if clumsy from the interface perspective. however, I have practised some hiragana before. i was just looking for another channel to keep me busy with japanese. so i made practically no mistakes (you must identify hiragana syllables to defeat demons). 
all off a sudden my party of 4 "heroes" got eliminated in just one fight starting from being 100% healthy despite I did not make any mistakes. 
I smell a rat!
technically the game had only covered 10 percent of what it had to cover, so why not make it unwinnable at that point? I doubt there is anyghing programmed ahead of the farm level. even if there was there is no point in letting the playere die over and over again if he fullfills the major goal of the game (which is identifying hiragana characters).
so - dont buy folks! invest your money in the "human japanese app" or "dr. moku"

author: {'steamid': '76561198275142448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1459535745}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046658417', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1459245266}
review:
So I played this for about 8hrs ofline and damn

Little background info: I have been learning japenese on the down-low with my home boy *cough*[spoiler]ROSETTA STONE[/spoiler]*cough* but the way they teach hiragana is a bit wonky. I was at the end of lvl 2 and I could barely remember more than 10 or so hiragana. I just couldn't get them to stick. Then I saw this on sale. I figured,"Eh, why not?" and purchased it right away. This was by far the best descion I have made this year

So going in I was a bit ahead of the curve knowing a bit of hiragana and a booty ton of the spoken language, I thought that I might not get much out of this. Boy howdy was I wrong. Ever have trouble studing because fuck me I can't focus? Well I usually power through it, but with the way of presenting it as grinding I just did what comes naturally for any jrpg... I leveled a few levels ahead of what I was supposed to be and completed all the side quests before advancing the story, and would you know it those are great ways to memorize the hiragana.

That's this entire games premise if you haven't guessed yet, and boy does it do it well. You play a filthy normie who has never even heard of a Jaypan before who must learn hiragana to defeat an evil wizard bent on ruling the world with his hiragana warriors! You start to learn with the help of your new teacher and chase after the evil wizard. This game despite being educational is a bit funny and light-hearted. TBH fampai it's not the most well written and can be predictable, but it is way above average for a game who's purpose is to educate your gajin self.

TL;DR
It's fun and actually teaches you if you're like me and pay attention to grinding. Definitely would recommend to anyone seeking to learn japenese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050259417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1711308004}
review: If u want to study a bit of Japanese, then this is the right game for you to start! You get to know the language step by step and the compensation between an rpg and an education is awesomeeeee! Warning. you might get a little addicted like me. Looking forward to the Katakana Battle!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198251023766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1458760591}
review:
I just finished this game and I must say this is an awesome japanese introduction for beginners. The structure, pacing  and repetition needed to really learn something is there and you can tell, that the developer really put thought into methods how to teach japanese content. 

The game itself is mediocre... standard RPG-Maker game with random and slooooow battles (a speed-up button would have been nice), but learning japanese with a game is really fun because you see your own progress. :)

Review:
Educational content 10/10 (this is why you buy this game ;) )
Game 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198029508408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1458589169}
review:
Sometimes you actually DO need your hand held.  In my opinion this game progresses very well.  If English is your first language, then Hiragana looks alien. It can be Intimidating at times.  Early on, you don't get the impression that "This is all over my head". Each lesson is small with the right amount of repetition to keep you interested. Everything you learn in each lesson is easily accessed for reminders.  

On the game side of things, I think it was a really nice touch.  We can face facts. If you like JRPG‚Äôs, you likely buy imports since it‚Äôs not a very popular genre outside of Japan (Hence the "J" part). Some of them don‚Äôt exactly offer English as an option for Subtitles.  

I think the point the developers are trying to make with this game is crystal clear.  I also believe they have succeeded.  Ive enjoyed my time with it. I‚Äôm continuing to enjoy my time with it. I also highly recommend it. 

-	‚ÄúYou have your Pen and Paper right‚Äù? :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198008762737', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1456220784}
review:
When I was very early into learning Japanese this helped me quite a bit at learning Hiragana, and is a nice easy and well designed game to introduce very early stage Japanese learners to the Japanese language, a lot of people say that you don't need a full game to teach you hiragana, since you can acomplish the same goal in several days using Anki and learning by repetition, but I think this game is still worth it, make sure to get a notebook and a pencil to practice writing down the hiragana yourself, as it will help you greatly for learning the stroke orders, which will help you later when it comes to forming words.

Overall, this game is cute, and ultimately was what made me decide to start learning Japanese in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017374635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1458482688}
review:
This is a great game for getting to know the hiragana characters and how they are used. It's nothing more than a small first step to actually learning Japanese though, so don't expect getting a lot out of it. 

Some specific things I disliked:
- Game felt short. 
- Hiragana enemy groups are not random but preset, so after a while you just know the group of monsters you face, rather than knowing the characters
- Because of the way the menu is set up, sometimes you can guess a character by the place it has in the menu rather than actually knowing it. I tried to circumvent this for myself by not opening the menu until I knew what I wanted to answer.
- I would have really liked if there was a post-endgame dungeon where all the characters are present and you fight them randomly, rather than preset groups. With the game right now I don't really come away feeling I mastered all the characters, and feel like I still need more and better practice.

So all in all I do recommend the game, I learned from it and it was fun, but it's not perfect or comprehensive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064943327', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1458350864}
review:
I've just finished the game! I truly loved it! It truly helps you out to learn. I was surprised it even teaches you how to write each hiragana character. Great tips too! I'm in love with it!

My suggestions would be: 

1) Once you finish an area or specific quests, it could be great to have quick shortcut portals to move to other cities faster. 

2) Music gets repetitive when in fighting mode with Hiragana Warriors at the beginning. Keep in mind we want to repeat areas as many times as possible until we fully memorize the characters. So it would be great if music were random and with a wider selection. Not just same everytime. I truly loved the music at the ending and overall!! Cutie Anime style :).

3) If you are a woman, japanese pronunciation should be studied from a Japanese female voice because male japanese voices are really different. If the player is a boy he should learn male pronunciation. It could be good to be given this option too.

4) More vocabulary quizes :).

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027329825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1625616725}
review:
Deutsches Review / English Review 

Hab das Spiel soeben beendet. Mit allen Sidequests hat es ca. 17 Stunden gedauert.

Die Kombination aus Spielen und Lernen ist super! Man wiederholt Hiragana indem man Hiraganamonster in zuf√§lligen K√§mpfen im Final Fantasy Stil besiegt und lernt Hiragana zu schreiben, indem man sich die jeweiligen Schreibanimationen dazu ansieht. Einfache Vorkabeln werden einem im Spiel auch beigebracht.

Was die Story angeht, ist Learn Japanese To Survive! Hiragana Battle nichts besonderes, unterh√§lt aber trotzdem.

F√ºr jeden, der Japanisch lernen m√∂chte, sich aber nie dazu √ºberwinden konnte anzufangen, kann dieses Game ein guter Einstieg sein. Besonders f√ºr Leute, die zu faul sind ein Buch f√ºr solche Zwecke in die Hand zu nehmen - so wie ich :D


######################################

I just finished the game. It took about 17 hours with all sidequests completed.
The combination of playing and learning is great! You revise hiragana by fighting "Hiragana"Monsters in random battles and learn to write hiragana by watching the writing animation in the game. 
There are also Vocabulary Lessons. 

The Story about an evil Mage sending hiragana warriors into the world, to conquer it, is nothing special, but quite entertaining. 

So, if you want to start to learn the japanese lanquage, this game can be of great help. Especially for lazy people who don¬¥t like to read books ... like me :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198057231688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1457275452}
review:
Das Wichtigste vorweg: Liebe Hersteller, macht bitte euer Spiel f√ºr Katakana schnell fertig! Einen K√§ufer habt ihr auf jeden Fall.

Nun aber zum eigentlichen Bericht:

Ich habe mir dieses Spiel gekauft, da ich schon immer an Japan interessiert war und schon mal die Schriftzeichen lernen wollte. Leider ist es halt so, dass man sie schnell wieder vergisst, wenn man sie nicht mehr aktiv lernt oder dass man nach kurzer Zeit keine Lust mehr hat sie stupide auswendig zu lernen. 

Deswegen dachte ich, dass dieses Spiel eine interessante Alternative zur Karteikarte sei und das ist es auch.

+ Man f√§ngt mit einem Set an Zeichen an und lernt im Laufe der Zeit immer wieder neue Sets.
+ Die Story wird zwar keinen Oscar gewinnen, ist aber unterhaltsam genug um weiter zu spielen.
+ Die Grafik ist passend. Insbesondere Fans alter JRPGs ala Final Fantasy werden sich freuen. 
+ Der Preis ist mehr als fair

- Im Allgemeinen ist das Spiel sehr repetitiv. Man lernt ein neues Set an Zeichen und geht dann in ein Gebiet, in dem man vorrangig von diesen Zeichen attackiert wird, welche man besiegt indem man ihnen ihre √úbersetzung an den Kopf wirft. Wenn das geschafft ist, lernt man mehr Zeichen, geht in ein neues Gebiet, √ºbersetzt die gelernten Zeichen usw usw.
- Leider kein Wiederspielwert
- Sprache leider nur auf Englisch

Ich bin mir nat√ºrlich bewusst, dass man nur durch Repetition lernt, aber ein wenig mehr Abwechslung w√§re lustig. Vielleicht mal Gegner einbringen, die man nicht durch √úbersetzungen besiegt, sondern in alter FF-Manier. Das ist jedoch Kritik auf sehr hohem Niveau. 
Ein weiterer Kritikpunkt ist, dass jedes Gebiet sein eigenes Set an Zeichen hat, die vorrangig attackieren, was dazu f√ºhrt, dass, wenn ich mal ein altes Set wiederholen m√∂chte, ich in Gebiete gehen muss, die keine Erfahrungspunkte mehr bringen oder storytechnisch vollkommen irrelevant geworden sind. Da w√§re es sch√∂ner, dass geschaffte Gebiete einfach alle Zeichen mit der selben Wahrscheinlchkeit beherbergen.

Summa Summarum: Ein Spiel, welches mir sehr viel Spa√ü gemacht hat und welches ich noch oft starten werde um zu √ºben.

Tl;dR:
Kauft es! Ihr werdet dadurch NICHT japanisch sprechen k√∂nnen, aber ihr werdet Hiragana lesen und schreiben k√∂nnen. Aber Vorsicht, das Spiel ist komplett auf Englisch.

Liebe Entwickler, bitte √ºbersetzt euren n√§chsten Titel! Zur Not meldet euch bei mir, dann mach ich das :D

MfG
Der Dreizopf

Perfekt f√ºr Leute die Japanisch lernen wollen und wie ich, nicht wissen wo sie anfangen sollen. Das Spiel an sich ist nicht zu untersch√§tzen. Wer nicht lernt, wird mit dem virtuellen Tod bestraft. Game Over.
Freue mich schon auf eine Fortsetzung, obwohl ich kein gro√üer Fan von japanischen Rollenspielen bin. Aber mit dem Hintergrund eine Sprache lernen zu k√∂nnen und vielleicht auch noch etwas √ºber die Kultur des Landes, das mich schon lange fasziniert, zu erfahren ist mir durchaus das Geld und die Zeit wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245830348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1457748892}
review:
This really is an educational RPG that's perfect for beginners. I was surprised at how engaging it was and how much I learned in such a short time. The story isn't bad at all and some of the NPC dialogue is lighthearted and funny.

You do learn hiragana in this game in a sort of combat oriented kind of way. It's a really cool idea and I'm really, really hoping to see something similar done with kanji. Then again, I haven't played this game for too long, so maybe kanji will be introduced later on.

I really just wanted to jump over here and write this game a positive review as soon as possible.

Also, it runs great, doesn't crash, has good portrait art imho, and a pretty relaxing soundtrack. I'm also a fan of the simplicity in the game and, to be perfectly honest, the price tag. I'm sort of sick of seeing games on here that are $40 or more. lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198162426349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1457619075}
review: It's an interesting game to help you to remember those japanese characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002121412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1457692247}
review:
So, I decided to pick up this game on a whim.  I ran across it as I was searching for anything RPG, and the title caught me.  As a servicemember living in Japan, with a japanese girlfriend, I decided I would like to try playing a game to help me learn to read/write hiragana.  I already speak a liittle, but I can't read a thing living here.  So far the game has proven to be very helpful, and I can't believe how much I've learned in so little time!  

The lessons are at your own pace, and you get the options for repetition of drawing examples and speaking examples.  

The combat is simple, but it reminds me of my old days of playing Golden sun on Gameboy Advance.  It engages you enough to keep you thinking, but also quizes you constantly on your knowledge of the written characters.  "You can use a cheat sheet to make sure you are memorizing them.  I first try to figure them out in my head, then review my notebook to make sure I have it right."

It's a little adventure, and has gear upgrades...  What can I say?  It's an RPG.  

The price of $6.99 seems well worth it for me to learn better japanese.

9/10 after 2 hours of playing.  would make 10/10 if added more explosion effects.
